instruction: As Taylor Kim, creator of the recipe '-Herb Tea-' (recipe_id=860), I need to update my recipe. First, add a new ingredient named 'fresh mint' with category='herb' and plural form 'fresh mints' to the Ingredient table. Then create a Quantity entry linking it to my recipe with min_qty=10, max_qty=12, unit='leaves', preparation='lightly crushed', and optional='no'. Execute these updates sequentially.

actions.sql: INSERT INTO Ingredient (category, name, plural) VALUES ('herb', 'fresh mint', 'fresh mints');
SELECT ingredient_id FROM Ingredient WHERE name='fresh mint' AND category='herb' AND plural='fresh mints';
INSERT INTO Quantity (recipe_id, ingredient_id, min_qty, max_qty, unit, preparation, optional) VALUES (860, {ingredient_id}, 10, 12, 'leaves', 'lightly crushed', 'no');

instruction: I am rd_jones_721, a registered dietitian. For recipe_id 1089 ('Chicken Pasta Salad'), update the protein content in the Nutrition table from 7.99g to 10.99g. Also, for quantity_id 4357 (linked to recipe_id 1089 and ingredient_id 2121, 'low calorie Italian salad dressing'), set max_qty and min_qty to 1.5 cups while retaining the unit and other details.

actions.sql: SELECT * FROM User WHERE user_id = 'rd_jones_721'
UPDATE Nutrition SET protein = 10.99 WHERE recipe_id = 1089
UPDATE Quantity SET max_qty = 1.5, min_qty = 1.5 WHERE quantity_id = 4357 AND recipe_id = 1089 AND ingredient_id = 2121

instruction: Authenticate me as Priya Verma. I want to update the Limeade recipe (recipe_id 865). First, insert a new ingredient into the Ingredient table with ingredient_id 2001, category 'Herb', name 'Fresh Mint', and plural 'Fresh Mints'. Then, add an entry to the Quantity table with quantity_id 501, recipe_id 865, ingredient_id 2001, max_qty 5, min_qty 5, unit 'sprigs', preparation 'finely chopped', and optional status 'no'.

actions.sql: INSERT INTO Ingredient (ingredient_id, category, name, plural) VALUES (2001, 'Herb', 'Fresh Mint', 'Fresh Mints');
INSERT INTO Quantity (quantity_id, recipe_id, ingredient_id, max_qty, min_qty, unit, preparation, optional) VALUES (501, 865, 2001, 5, 5, 'sprigs', 'finely chopped', 'no');

instruction: First, verify that recipe_id 831 (Wheat Thins Crackers) has source 'food_blogger_998'. If confirmed: 1) Insert a new ingredient named 'whole wheat flour' (plural: 'whole wheat flours', category: 'flour') into the Ingredient table. 2) Add a quantity entry for recipe_id 831 using the newly created 'whole wheat flour' (identified by name='whole wheat flour' and category='flour'), with quantity_id=1001, min_qty=1.5, max_qty=1.5, unit='cup', preparation=NULL, optional='no'.

actions.sql: SELECT source FROM Recipe WHERE recipe_id = 831;
INSERT INTO Ingredient (category, name, plural) VALUES ('flour', 'whole wheat flour', 'whole wheat flours');

INSERT INTO Quantity (quantity_id, recipe_id, ingredient_id, max_qty, min_qty, unit, preparation, optional) VALUES (1001, 831, (SELECT ingredient_id FROM Ingredient WHERE name='whole wheat flour' AND category='flour'), 1.5, 1.5, 'cup', NULL, 'no');

instruction: Jamie Clark (user_id: nutri_cook93) needs to update recipe_id 254 ('No-Bake Fruit Crisp') from Canned Fruit Promotion Service. First, increase servings from 6 to 8. Then, add 0.5 cup(s) of walnuts (ingredient_id:77) as a mandatory ingredient with quantity_id:360. Ensure no special preparation is specified.

actions.sql: UPDATE Recipe SET servings = 8 WHERE recipe_id = 254;
INSERT INTO Quantity (quantity_id, recipe_id, ingredient_id, max_qty, min_qty, unit, preparation, optional) VALUES (360, 254, 77, 0.5, 0.5, 'cup(s)', NULL, 'FALSE');

instruction: As user 458 (source: '458'), I need to update my recipe (recipe_id: 1565). Change protein to 27.5g, calories to 310kcal, and fiber to 8.2g in its nutrition profile. For ingredient_id 204 in this recipe, update quantity_id 91 to use 2.0-3.5 cups. Confirm authorization and apply changes.

actions.sql: UPDATE Nutrition n SET protein = 27.5, calories = 310, fiber = 8.2 FROM Recipe r WHERE n.recipe_id = 1565 AND r.recipe_id = n.recipe_id AND r.source = '458';

UPDATE Quantity q SET min_qty = 2.0, max_qty = 3.5, unit = 'cups' FROM Recipe r WHERE q.quantity_id = 91 AND q.recipe_id = 1565 AND q.ingredient_id = 204 AND r.recipe_id = q.recipe_id AND r.source = '458';

instruction: I need to update the Nutrition record for my recipe titled '-All-Bran Cereal-' (recipe_id 931). Please set sodium to 110.0 and vitamin_c to 10.0. Additionally, insert a new Quantity record for this recipe with quantity_id 1, ingredient_id 5, maximum quantity 100.0 grams, minimum quantity 50.0 grams, preparation 'crushed', and mark it as non-optional.

actions.sql: UPDATE Nutrition SET sodium = 110.0, vitamin_c = 10.0 WHERE recipe_id = 931
INSERT INTO Quantity (quantity_id, recipe_id, ingredient_id, max_qty, min_qty, unit, preparation, optional) VALUES (1, 931, 5, 100.0, 50.0, 'grams', 'crushed', 'no')

instruction: Hello, I'm Sam. Please update recipe ID 721's protein value to 3.5 grams in the Nutrition table. Also, create a new quantity record with ID 555 for this recipe: ingredient ID 10, fixed quantity 4.0 whole scrubbed units (non-optional).

actions.sql: UPDATE Nutrition SET protein = 3.5 WHERE recipe_id = 721
INSERT INTO Quantity (quantity_id, recipe_id, ingredient_id, max_qty, min_qty, unit, preparation, optional) VALUES (555, 721, 10, 4.0, 4.0, 'whole', 'scrubbed', 'no')

instruction: My name is Anita Zhao, developer of recipe 945. I'm improving the protein content of my Parmesan Cheese recipe (recipe_id: 945). Please: 1. Verify my authorization. 2. Add 'Skim Milk Powder' to Ingredient table with category 'Dairy', plural 'Skim Milk Powders'. 3. Assign ingredient_id and add to recipe 945 with min 15g, max 20g, no preparation, required. 4. Update Nutrition table to set protein = 6.6g for this recipe.

actions.sql: SELECT source FROM Recipe WHERE recipe_id = 945
INSERT INTO Ingredient (category, name, plural) VALUES ('Dairy', 'Skim Milk Powder', 'Skim Milk Powders')
SELECT ingredient_id FROM Ingredient WHERE name = 'Skim Milk Powder'
INSERT INTO Quantity (recipe_id, ingredient_id, min_qty, max_qty, unit, preparation, optional) VALUES (945, <ingredient_id>, 15, 20, 'g', 'none', 'no')
UPDATE Nutrition SET protein = 6.6 WHERE recipe_id = 945

instruction: Authenticate as user 789. Modify recipe 1122 ('Dilled Potato Rounds Fish Fillets'): 1) Insert Greek yogurt (ingredient_id:2400, category:'dairy', name:'Greek yogurt', plural:NULL) into Ingredient. 2) Add Quantity entry (recipe_id:1122, ingredient_id:2400, min_qty:0.5, max_qty:0.5, unit:'cup(s)', preparation:'as mayonnaise substitute', optional:'FALSE'). 3) Update Quantity for Dijon mustard (ingredient_id:1025) in recipe 1122 to preparation:'low sodium'.

actions.sql: INSERT INTO Ingredient (ingredient_id, category, name, plural) VALUES (2400, 'dairy', 'Greek yogurt', NULL);
INSERT INTO Quantity (recipe_id, ingredient_id, min_qty, max_qty, unit, preparation, optional) VALUES (1122, 2400, 0.5, 0.5, 'cup(s)', 'as mayonnaise substitute', 'FALSE');
UPDATE Quantity SET preparation = 'low sodium' WHERE recipe_id = 1122 AND ingredient_id = 1025;
